p: The incidence of dengue has grown rapidly around the world over the last decades. Batth et al [ 1] estimated that around 390 million (95% CI: 284–528) dengue infections occurred per year, of which 96 million (95% CI: 67–136) are symptomatic (any level of disease severity). Dengue is currently an important public health problem worldwide. Brady et al [ 2] estimated that 3.9 billion people, in 128 countries, live in areas at risk for dengue viruses’ infection. In Asia, dengue hemorrhagic fever is predominant in children, while in the Americas adults are more often affected [ 3, 4].
